item.title: Car appears to be abandoned, 1st August
item.description:
This vehicle has been parked in the same place for about two months (next to the hedge outside no.1 Horn Park Lane), and does not appear to be being used. There were two cars parked in this location that appeared together and now the damaged one has been removed. This vehicle still remains and may have been stolen and dumped here. It is very unusual for a car to be left and unused for such a long time on Horn Park Lane. This needs to be investigated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Horn Park Lane, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fast growing trees - spreading, blocking pavements 98 Greencroft Gardens and in a few other areas on the street, 1st August
item.description:
I’m writing to report a concern about a rapidly growing tree species on council-managed land outside 98 Greencroft Gardens, NW6, and increasingly along the full length of Greencroft Gardens. The trees are spreading quickly, blocking parts of the pavement and spreading onto private properties. While I cannot confirm the exact species, the trees resemble Tree of Heaven (Ailanthus altissima), which is known for its ability to spread rapidly if not controlled. I kindly request that the council: • Investigate the tree species in this area • Take appropriate action to control or remove the trees where necessary

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 98, Greencroft Gardens, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
